elements.title: Draken (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Draken (pictured) is the tallest, fastest, and joint-steepest roller coaster in South Korea?

elements.title: In Eutropium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ancient Roman poem In Eutropium criticized the politician Eutropius for holding a "feminine" triumph?

elements.title: Montgomery Brawl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Fader praised "Montgomery Brawl" as "a hilarious recap" of the brawl and a "song a piece of history deserves"?

elements.title: Lillian V. Holdeman Moore (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lillian V. Holdeman Moore identified a spike in hydrogen-gas-producing bacteria in Skylab astronauts?

elements.title: Myrthen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Eric Sams remarked "what bride ever had a finer wedding gift?" of the song collection Myrthen (Myrtles), which Robert Schumann dedicated to Clara?

elements.title: world constitution (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that since 1977, a world constitution has existed alongside a Provisional World Parliament?

elements.title: Get Him Back! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the music video for Olivia Rodrigo's song "Get Him Back!" was shot on an iPhone 15 Pro?

elements.title: a former rayon mill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that smokestacks at a former rayon mill were stabilized by dropping bricks into them?
